Package com.esri.mo2.xml.prj

Classes provide support for loading/saving an ArcXML configuration files.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
LayoutProject This class contains functionality to handle loading/saving of an Extended ArcXML configuration file (default file extension is "*.axl").
MapProject This class contains functionality to handle loading/saving of an ArcXML1.1(Standard ArcXML) configuration file (default file extension is "*.axl").
 

Exception Summary
UnMarshallingException This exception is thrown by MO Java ArcXML serializer if something is wrong in an ArcXML input.
 

Package com.esri.mo2.xml.prj Description

Classes provide support for loading/saving an ArcXML configuration files.

Map and Layout objects can be de/serialized in the configuration files. For the purpose of de/serialization of a layout a special xml-based language was being designed. This language extends ArcXML v.1.1 in several directions and is called the extended ArcXML. Accordingly ArcXML v1.1 might be referenced as the standard ArcXML.

In the extended ArcXML a map configuration file of the standard ArcXML can be represented by an appropriate layout configuration file. This layout configuration file should consist of one map element that includes exactly the same map description as the map configuration file does have. So, from functional point of view, both Map and Layout can be de/serialized using by the extended ArcXML only. LayoutProject class was being designed to accomplish this goal. LayoutProject can read both the standard and extended versions of ArcXML and write out a configuration file of the extended version only. It is recommended to use this class for de/serialization both Map and Layout as well. There are several static helper methods in ui.xml.ClientProjectHelper class to facilitate de/serialization a map in the case of using LayoutProject class for a client-side application. LayoutProject class is placed in com.esri.mo2.xml.prj folder.

The main purpose of MapProject class is to provide compatibility between the configuration files and the ArcIMS map services. The class can be used to de/serialize a single map. Moreover it can read and write configuration files in the standard ArcXML only. Therefore this class would fail, if one could try to serialize a map that includes a data source behind the standard ArcXML specification like SDC, CAD etc. It is not recommended to use the class for de/serialization of a map, if there is no a direct requirement regarding this matter
